content: Email address not valid. You can edit the email by double-clicking on it.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a message indicating that an email address is invalid. It appears as a tooltip on a help button in an invite panel component. Translators should provide a descriptive error message to guide users when editing an invalid email address.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'بإمكانك' could be more naturally rendered as 'يمكنك'. While 'بإمكانك' is grammatically correct, 'يمكنك' is more common in spoken Saudi Arabic.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: يمكنك تعديل البريد الإلكتروني بالنقر المزدوج عليه.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrasing 'že na něj dvakrát kliknete' is grammatically awkward. A more natural way to say it in Czech would be 'kliknutím na něj dvakrát'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: E-mailová adresa není platná. E-mailovou adresu můžete upravit kliknutím na něj dvakrát.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation uses a period after 'platná' and then a space before 'E-mailovou'. This is unconventional.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: E-mailová adresa není platná. E-mailovou adresu můžete upravit kliknutím na něj dvakrát.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'not valid' is translated as 'ei ole olemassa' which means 'does not exist'. This implies the email address is entirely unknown, rather than just incorrectly formatted. 'Ei ole pätevä' would be a more accurate translation for 'not valid' in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Sähköpostiosoite ei ole pätevä. Voit muokata sähköpostia kaksoisnapsauttamalla sitä.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Դուք կարող եք խմբագրել նամակը՝ կրկնակի սեղմելով դրա վրա:' literally translates to 'You can edit the letter by double-clicking on it.'  The English refers to 'email', not 'letter'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Էլփոստի հասցեն վավեր չէ: Դուք կարող եք խմբագրել էլփոստի հասցեն՝ կրկնակի սեղմելով դրա վրա:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'ຄລິກສອງຄັ້ງໃສ່ມັນ' (klik song khang sai man) can be improved for clarity and flow. 'ໃສ່ມັນ' is not necessary and slightly awkward.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ຄລິກສອງຄັ້ງທີ່ຢູ່ອີເມວ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Polish translation uses a full stop (period) at the end of the sentence, which might not be consistent with the English version if it uses a different punctuation style. Consider if this punctuation choice is appropriate for the context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review the style guide or previous translations to determine the appropriate punctuation style for error messages.  If the English version uses no punctuation at the end, consider removing the full stop.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Pode editar o email ao clicar duas vezes sobre ele' is grammatically awkward. It's better to use a more natural phrasing.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Pode editar o e-mail clicando duas vezes sobre ele.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'clicando duas vezes nele' is a somewhat literal translation. A more natural phrasing would be 'clicando duas vezes sobre ele' or 'clicando duas vezes no campo'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: clicando duas vezes sobre ele

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The pronoun 'acesta' (this) refers to 'adresa de email' (email address) which is feminine. The correct pronoun should be feminine as well.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Adresa de email nu este valabilă. Puteţi modifica adresa de email făcând dublu clic pe aceasta.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'වි-තැපැල්' is a compound word that can be simplified. The 'වි-' prefix is unnecessary and sounds awkward in modern Sinhala.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: තැපැල් ලිපිනය

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While grammatically correct, the sentence structure is slightly clunky.  A more natural flow would be to separate the two actions.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: තැපැල් ලිපිනය වලංගු නොවේ. එය නැවත සංස්කරණය කිරීමට, දෙවරක් ක්ලික් කරන්න.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'ඊමේල් සංස්කරණය කළ හැකිය' is a literal translation but sounds less natural than alternatives. While accurate, a more idiomatic expression would be preferable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඊමේල් වෙනස් කළ හැකිය

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'naň' is a bit archaic and can be slightly awkward in modern Slovak. While grammatically correct, it could be improved for better readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Email môžete upraviť dvojitým kliknutím na ňu.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term "E-mail sporočilo" is awkward. "E-mail naslov" or simply "ga" would be more natural when referring to the email address being edited.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: E-mail naslov ni veljaven. Ga lahko uredite tako, da dvokliknete nanj.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence structure is a little verbose. Breaking it into two sentences might improve readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: E-mail naslov ni veljaven. Za urejanje e-pošte dvakrat kliknite nanjo.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation of 'Email address' is 'Емаил адреса'. 'Email' should ideally be translated as 'E-mail adresa' or 'Adresa e-pošte' for better Serbian understanding.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Е-mail адреса није важећа. Можете уредити емаил двоструким кликом на њега.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'valid' is translated as 'важећа' which is technically correct but 'исправна' might flow better in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Е-mail адреса није исправна. Можете уредити емаил двоструким кликом на њега.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'double-clicking' is rendered as 'двоструким кликом на њега'. While correct, 'два пута кликните на њега' could be more natural-sounding.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Е-mail адреса није исправна. Можете уредити емаил два пута кликните на њега.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Iu chan chỉnh sửa email sẽ tăng gấp đôi trên đó' doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'You can edit the email by double-clicking on it.' The phrase 'Iu chan chỉnh sửa email sẽ tăng gấp đôi trên đó' is nonsensical.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Bạn có thể chỉnh sửa email bằng cách nhấp đúp vào đó.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence structure is awkward and doesn't flow naturally in Vietnamese.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Rephrase the entire sentence for better flow, as suggested in the incorrect_translation issue.
